title: Former Married At First Sight star Melissa Walsh opens up about her battle with anorexia
text:
She won fans on last year's season of Married At First Sight.

And now Melissa Walsh - who was partnered with John Robertson on the 2018 season, is speaking candidly about her battle with an eating disorder.

In an emotionally raw Instagram post on Tuesday, the 54-year-old reality TV star revealed she grappled with anorexia as a teen.

Brave: She won fans on last year's season of Married At First Sight, and now Melissa Walsh is speaking candidly about her battle with an eating disorder

'From the time I was a teenager, I struggled with body image... I had anorexia at 15 and lost so much weight they wanted to hospitalise me,' she admitted.

Melissa said her eating disorder stemmed from a place of insecurity, with the journalist claiming she struggled to fit in.

'I hated the way I looked and always felt out of place and not good enough,' she confessed.

Struggles: In an emotionally raw Instagram post on Tuesday, the 54-year-old former MAFS star revealed she grappled with anorexia as a teen

'It wasn't till I was much older I realised how important it is to accept yourself as you are.'

Melissa said she was speaking out about her struggles in the hope it would help other people dealing with the same thing.

'I hate to see young girls and boys struggling with their self image and confidence,' she continued.

'From the time I was a teenager, I struggled with body image. I had anorexia at 15 and lost so much weight they wanted to hospitalise me,' she

'Love yourself for who you are. Know that you are perfect just the way you are and there's so much more to you than what you look like.

'The moment we realise this is when we find true peace and happiness.'

It's not the first time Melissa has opened up about her mental health battles.

Speaking out: Melissa said her eating disorder stemmed from a place of insecurity, with the journalist claiming she struggled to fit in. Pictured alongside former partner John Robertson on last year's Married At First Sight

Earlier this month, she revealed she had also struggled with anxiety, and saw counsellors to help her through it.

'Instagram is full of posts with smiles and laughter but there's a down side to life too which sometimes gets the better of us,' she wrote on Instagram.

'I have struggled over the years with anxiety and issues of self doubt, have seen counsellors and read lots of self help and spirituality books to find answers.'
